Description: Partitions data into k clusters minimizing within-cluster variance
Advantage: Simple, fast, scalable for large datasets
Disadvantage: Assumes spherical clusters; sensitive to initial centroids and outliers

Description: Builds a dendrogram by iteratively merging or splitting clusters
Advantage: Does not require specifying number of clusters; interpretable structure
Disadvantage: Computationally expensive; sensitive to distance metric and linkage method

Description: Reduces dimensionality using PCA before applying clustering
Disadvantage: Loss of interpretability from PCA transformation
